project_info.title: The Mystery Begins: A Silent Killer Hiding in Plain Sight

outline.title: The Mystery Begins: A Silent Killer Hiding in Plain Sight
outline.summary: Introduction to a medical mystery condition affecting 1.28 billion people globally, often without warning signs.
outline.image_plan: /home/ubuntu/upload/search_images/55RhBD9wd1mx.jpg - The slide introduces the presentation as an "Interactive Hypertension Puzzle." Image 7 is a clear visual of a healthcare puzzle concept.

outline.title: Puzzle Piece #1: The Predisposing Factors
outline.summary: Exploring genetic and demographic risk factors including age, race, gender, and family history.

outline.title: Puzzle Piece #2: Lifestyle Causes (Part A)
outline.summary: The impact of daily habits like excessive sodium intake, sedentary lifestyle, alcohol, and obesity.

outline.title: Puzzle Piece #3: Lifestyle Causes (Part B)
outline.summary: Hidden contributors including chronic stress, sleep deprivation, tobacco use, and caffeine.

outline.title: Puzzle Piece #4: Metabolic and Medical Causes
outline.summary: Underlying medical conditions such as insulin resistance, chronic kidney disease, and thyroid disorders.

outline.title: Puzzle Piece #5: The Symptom Clues
outline.summary: Why it is called the 'silent killer' and the rare symptoms that appear only in severe cases.
outline.image_plan: /home/ubuntu/upload/search_images/iVoiwue98o92.jpg - The slide discusses the "Silent Killer" and the importance of monitoring. Image 1 shows a person taking their blood pressure, which is the primary way to monitor the condition.

outline.title: The Diagnosis Revealed: Hypertension
outline.summary: Defining hypertension, its classification stages, and global mortality statistics.
outline.image_plan: /home/ubuntu/upload/search_images/J0dpKY3UCnEn.jpg - This slide reveals the diagnosis of Hypertension and provides the classification and blood pressure ranges. Image 3 is a detailed infographic specifically about High Blood Pressure, including classification stages and symptoms.

outline.title: A Growing Crisis: Incidence and Burden
outline.summary: Global prevalence rates, economic burden, and the rising numbers in developing nations.

outline.title: The Cost of Silence: Complications
outline.summary: Damage to organ systems including heart failure, stroke, kidney disease, and vision loss.
outline.image_plan: /home/ubuntu/upload/search_images/05PPOqCFtW07.jpg; /home/ubuntu/upload/search_images/dbxNBDNZSs7C.jpg - This slide details the complications of uncontrolled hypertension, specifically focusing on cardiovascular and vascular damage. Image 6 shows the heart and the progression of plaque buildup in the arteries, and Image 4 specifically illustrates Coronary Artery Disease (CAD) and plaque, both direct complications.

outline.title: Reclaiming Control: Lifestyle Management
outline.summary: Evidence-based interventions like the DASH diet, physical activity, and weight management.

outline.title: Medical Defense: Pharmacology & Monitoring
outline.summary: Overview of antihypertensive medications and the importance of consistent blood pressure monitoring.
outline.image_plan: /home/ubuntu/upload/search_images/7Pokj70yPX2z.jpg - This slide discusses pharmacological management and monitoring. Image 2 is a medical illustration defining hypertension with clear visuals of the heart and constricted artery, which is relevant to the mechanism of action of many antihypertensive drugs.

outline.title: The Future: Prevention & Outlook
outline.summary: Primary and secondary prevention strategies, emerging therapies, and a final call to action.
outline.image_plan: /home/ubuntu/upload/search_images/zgvaWPEejJNz.jpg - This slide discusses prevention, future outlook, and public health initiatives. Image 8, showing a stethoscope and a missing puzzle piece being placed, symbolizes solving the healthcare puzzle through intervention and monitoring.
